name: Fanbytes
description:
We like to think Fanbytes is what happens if a group of 19–22 year olds come together to create an advertising company they'd love.

We’re the world’s #1 Snapchat advertising network helping the world’s leading brands reach Generation Z . Through a mixture of engaging content & clever technology we’ve been behind some of the most powerful campaigns on Snapchat with global record labels, beauty brands and even “unsexy” government initiatives.

Our story has been featured everywhere from Forbes, Evening Standard and The Telegraph and we’ve even won some awards along the way.

team.title: CEO
team.name: Timothy Armoo
team.bioHtml: CEO @Lilli Chan .Helping the world’s largest brands become relevant to today’s millennials. 23 years young.

jobs.title: Senior Brand Partnerships (Toys and Gaming)
jobs.description:
About Fanbytes:
Fanbytes is an influencer marketing agency that helps brands like Apple Music, Deliveroo, King, Miniclip and even the UK Government reach Gen Z through influencers on Snapchat, Instagram, and TikTok.

We’ve rapidly grown the company to be named as one of the most influential companies in advertising as quoted by “The Evening Standard" and Forbes. Toys and gaming have increasingly become part of our focus and we’re looking for an experienced Brand Partnerships Manager to come in and eventually lead that division.

Responsibilities:
Identifying and outreaching to key brands and partners to sell our creative solutions.
Representing Fanbytes at industry events and speaking about our work in running campaigns.
Responding to inbounds and RFPs from brands.
Creating and pitching proposals to brands and agencies.
Leading a team of account executives and account managers in driving revenue for your pod.

Requirements: 
At least 3 years of selling creative solutions to brands or agencies.
Experience of working towards sales targets and managing one’s workload.
An extensive book of contacts in the toy world
Proficient with numbers and excel with the ability to interpret numbers to make decisions.
Creative and confident with words to draft proposals and campaign ideas for brands

Salary and Benefits:
£35k to £45k + commission on deals.
Rapid growth - the role is one step on the journey to being the Head of our new Toy and Games subdivision.
Clear Progression to becoming a key part of the commercial leadership team.
We’re a team of young people that believes in working hard, but also creating a fun environment. Think team breakfasts, weekly socials, and company days out.

jobs.title: Music Brand Partnerships Manager
jobs.description:
About Fanbytes:
Fanbytes is an influencer marketing agency that helps brands like Apple Music, Universal and Virgin EMI to reach Gen Z through influencers on Snapchat, Instagram, and TikTok.
With an average age of 23, we’ve rapidly grown the company to be named as one of the most influential companies in advertising as quoted by “The Evening Standard”.

Responsibilities:
Up-sell and cross-sell existing clients on new products and ad formats
Identify and create new opportunities for Fanbytes to expand within the music industry
Work with clients and influencers to come up with creative marketing ideas
Create decks, proposals and reports to present to senior music executives.

Requirements:
B2B sales experience, or experience managing music marketing budgets
Understanding of the music industry as well as youth trends.
Highly organised, efficient, and capable of managing and prioritising a diverse workload.
Confident and social personality - you’ll spend a lot of your time in meetings, on the phone, and at industry events.
Obsessed with youth and pop culture - we need you to stay on top of trending memes and hashtags, and know how artists and labels can use them to their advantage.

Salary & Benefits:
£24k + commission
Fast Career trajectory - we’re growing Fanbytes rapidly and want you to grow with us.
Good vibes - we’re a team of young people that believes in working hard, but also creating a fun environment. Think team breakfasts, weekly socials, and company days out.

jobs.title: Junior Account Manager
jobs.description:
About Fanbytes:
Fanbytes is on a mission to help world leading brands win the hearts of Gen Z through the most creative influencer campaigns on social media. Started in January 2017, our growing team of 30+ millennials and Gen Z have helped brands such as Charlotte Tilbury, Apple and even the UK government to reach younger audiences on Snapchat, Instagram and Tiktok. Our creativity in running global campaigns has seen us featured in publications like Forbes, The Evening Standard, and The Times.

About the job:
The Junior Account Manager will combine their creative prowess with their analytical mind to run a broad range of campaigns. This is one of the few jobs where knowing a lot about viral trends and pop culture can be put to good use to push the boundaries of millennial advertising on Snapchat, Instagram and Tiktok. Junior Account Managers work as part of our millennial campaigns team which is split into 3 verticals, you would be managing a campaign from start to finish with the support of a Senior Account Manager. 

What you'd be doing day to day:
Managing campaigns from start to finish working with influencers and our clients to achieve the highest results.
Engaging with our influencer team to source the best influencers and produce engaging branded content.
Maintaining relationships with brands to help them achieve their long-term marketing goals through our various products and ad formats

Requirements:
Creative minded and an interest in pop culture – if you live and breathe social media then you’ll do fine here.
Commercially minded - experience in client facing roles in the past is a plus but not necessary.
Comfortable with numbers and manipulating basic data to communicate the value of a campaign back to a client.
Communication & Leadership: Able to guide a client through their campaign by showcasing your expertise, communicating clearly, and reporting results.


Benefits:
£21k - £ 30 k (depending on experience) + commission
Large progressions for growth - we believe that everyone should be the entrepreneur in their own job and you will be managing a team of people to deliver results.
Fanbytes Day outs- our CEO loves axe throwing and archery so be ready to throw a bunch of stuff.
Millennial vibe - we believe in working hard but also creating a fun environment with other young forward thinking people.

jobs.title: Full-stack React / Node (GraphQL) Developer
jobs.description:
About Fanbytes:
Fanbytes is on a mission to help world leading brands to win the hearts of Gen Z through the most creative way possible across the social web. Started in January 2017, our growing team of 25+ millennials have guided brands such as Sony, Disney and Apple to understand how best to engage with a young audience on popular platforms such as Snapchat, Instagram and Tiktok.

About the job:
We are looking for a Full-stack React / Node (GraphQL) Developer. You will be responsible for taking design specs from our design team and building the frontend on our existing code base. This will include communicating with the wider team and using their feedback to inform product vision.

What you'd be doing day to day:
Building potential new features and high fidelity mockups for agreed features.
Speaking with our internal campaigns and account management teams to get feedback on builds.
Liaising with our design team to ensure the needs of the product are understood.
Taking feedback from clients and using this to make adjustments to the implementation of the product.

Requirements:
Strong experience with React and GraphQL
Examples of previous web app or mobile app products.
Experience working with user flow diagrams and mocking up how a product will function.
Comfortable working in an agile fashion with fast changing requirements.
Ability to understand the concepts of the technical product and to have a basic understanding of what the possibilities of a technical product are.

Benefits:
Large progressions for growth - we believe that everyone should be the entrepreneur in their own job and you will be managing a team of people to deliver results.
Fanbytes Day outs- our CEO loves axe throwing and archery so be ready to throw a bunch of stuff.
Millennial vibe - we believe in working hard but also creating a fun environment with other young forward thinking people.
£35 - 50k depending on experience.
